alert.note: Alert for Greeley; Wichita (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 18 at 7:46PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Wichita and southeastern Greeley Counties through 715 PM MDT/815 PM CDT/... At 646 PM MDT/746 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 14 miles southwest of Leoti, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southern Wichita and southeastern Greeley Counties, including the following locations... Lydia and Selkirk. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM MDT/900 PM CDT/ for west central Kansas.
